featured.text: None of them, however, has been proven to be entirely true.
He first tried cotton, but it proved too soft and could not withstand repeated openings and closures.
Studies have proved that watching funny movies can reduce pain and promote healing.
King Henry V of England is credited with having invented the first true passport, as a way of helping his subjects prove who they were in foreign lands.

In fact, 34 health studies prove that exercise doesn’t have to hurt to be effective.
If the research proves successful in humans, some of the nearly 40 million blind people worldwide may one day have a tiny, striped fish to thank. 43.

To prove that classrooms there are big enough to host many families.

definition.zh_def: 證明，證實某事的真實性或有效性。
definition.en_def: To establish the truth or validity of something through evidence or argument.
definition.example: She had to prove her identity before she could access the account.
